pros: Great coworkers, self-schedule so you can mostly pick your days to work as long as you work some weekends, since it’s a small hospital you get to know everyone, changing or trying out new units is fairly easy. Pay is good, don’t have to work a lot or holidays, and they’re pretty flexible regarding scheduling, uniform, etc
cons: Equipment is old, insurance is ok, not a lot of resources to provide perks and benefits for employees.

pros: Good team and colleagues. Friendly staff
cons: Bad benefits and pay raises.

pros: You can pick your shifts because they are so short staffed and always have open shifts.  Location is right off of 495.
cons: Everything about this job. Lack of support from supervisors and very short staffed. Schedulers will cancel nurses to make shift even shorter. It feels like you are working a double because in order to get all your notes done, you typically stay 2-3 hours past your shift.  After working an overnight, hope you don’t need any sleep because the scheduler will call you first thing in the morning. “Oh you’re sleeping” is the typical comment.  Case loads are pretty much impossible to keep up.

pros: Worked on 3 different units and all were flexible with my school schedule up until I left. Everyone there is friendly and always willing to help! Never had a problem with any coworker. The benefits are also awesome! Overall great place to work!
cons: Starting pay was a little lower than I expected, but I did get annual raises and there was differentials for night shift and OT. Cafeteria food was a little expensive, but that comes with any hospital.

pros: Simplicity of unit and  standardization of orders by physicians prescribing care of patients. Team oriented approach to patient care .
cons: Increase in hourly salary depends on evaluation based on discretion of individual who discriminates based on familiarity with individuals .

pros: Team work and Patient Service is Excellent in this hospital
cons: Cannot think of any cons for this employer  Everyone is nice and you will feel you are part of the big family
